intro: Eriocephalus giessii, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant is often found in rocky areas and along coastal regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are typically visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. Eriocephalus giessii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
